dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Amazon just bought Deliveroo, right? Wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Amazon just bought Deliveroo, right? Wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The probe from the CMA is somewhat unusual given Amazon is only a minority shareholder in Deliveroo, which was last valued at $2 billion in 2017 when it raised a $482 million round.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, no, not bought bought. Not yet, anyway! The CMA, like, issued this order.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, no, not bought bought. Not yet, anyway! The C M A, like, issued this order.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) issued an initial enforcement order on Friday over fears that the two companies have ceased to be distinct following a $575 million funding round into Deliveroo in May, which was led by Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, the Competition and Markets Authority. Right. Because of Amazon's investment?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, the Competition and Markets Authority. Right. Because of Amazon's investment?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! They dropped, what, five hundred seventy-five million into Deliveroo? For a minority stake, mind you.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! They dropped, what, five hundred seventy-five million into Deliveroo? For a minority stake, mind you.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) issued an initial enforcement order on Friday over fears that the two companies have ceased to be distinct following a $575 million funding round into Deliveroo in May, which was led by Amazon. The probe from the CMA is somewhat unusual given Amazon is only a minority shareholder in Deliveroo...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A minority stake, yeah, but still! And Deliveroo's, like, massive now. All those riders, all that data.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A minority stake, yeah, but still! And Deliveroo's, like, massive now. All those riders, all that data.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It relies on an army of 60,000 riders to transport food from 80,000 restaurants to people's homes and offices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! And the CMA is really worried about a monopolistic grip. Like, uh, exploiting the rider network, the customer data.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! And the C M A is really worried about a monopolistic grip. Like, uh, exploiting the rider network, the customer data.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The CMA said it is also concerned that the two companies could merge at some point in the future. ... European regulators are clamping down on U.S. tech giants over allegedly monopolistic and uncompetitive tactics.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's the real gold, isn't it? The data. And Amazon already dominates, like, everything else.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the real gold, isn't it? The data. And Amazon already dominates, like, everything else.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Plus, Amazon tried food delivery before, remember? Amazon Restaurants? Didn't work out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Plus, Amazon tried food delivery before, remember? Amazon Restaurants? Didn't work out.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Closer cooperation between the two companies could see Deliveroo customers placing orders via Amazon Alexa, or a takeover would give the Seattle-based giant a second try at the food delivery business after it scrapped its rival service Amazon Restaurants in June.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, I totally forgot about that! So this is their way back in, potentially?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, I totally forgot about that! So this is their way back in, potentially?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Could be! And the regulators are getting super aggressive with these U.S. tech giants anyway.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Could be! And the regulators are getting super aggressive with these U.S. tech giants anyway.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, European regulators are clamping down on U.S. tech giants over allegedly monopolistic and uncompetitive tactics.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Google got hit hard, right? For like, favouring their own stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Google got hit hard, right? For like, favouring their own stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For example, Google was fine recently by the European Commission for promoting its own Google Shopping service in its search results ahead of other retailers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! So this Deliveroo deal, even with a minority stake, it's raising a lot of eyebrows.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! So this Deliveroo deal, even with a minority stake, it's raising a lot of eyebrows.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But Deliveroo's saying it's all about, like, jobs and choice. And innovation!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But Deliveroo's saying it's all about, like, jobs and choice. And innovation!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A spokesperson for Deliveroo said: Deliveroo and Amazon have been working closely with regulators to obtain regulatory approvals. ... This investment will enable Deliveroo to expand, innovate and, we believe, will enhance competition. This investment will help create jobs, help restaurants to grow their businesses and will improve choice for consumers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. And Amazon's saying the same thing. But the CMA, they're not buying it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. And Amazon's saying the same thing. But the C M A, they're not buying it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: An Amazon spokesperson said: We believe this minority investment will enable Deliveroo to expand its services, benefiting consumers through increased choice and creating new jobs as more restaurants gain access to the service. ... A spokeswoman for the CMA told Forbes that the initial enforcement order (IEO) has been issued to effectively pause the deal between Amazon and Deliveroo while it decides whether it needs to complete what is known as a Phase 1 investigation...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, not at all! They're saying the companies aren't operating independently anymore.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not at all! They're saying the companies aren't operating independently anymore.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, the CMA said it has reasonable grounds to believe the two companies are no longer distinct.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Even with the "complex shareholding structure." It's, like, messy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even with the complex shareholding structure. It's, like, messy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Super messy. And unusual, for a minority stake.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Super messy. And unusual, for a minority stake.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The probe from the CMA is somewhat unusual given Amazon is only a minority shareholder in Deliveroo... Jonathan Branton, head of EU competition at DWF, said: Investigations into acquisitions of minority stakes are certainly less common than they are for standard acquisitions, but that is not to say they do not happen.
